text: Cailledh the Crimson, Goddess of Warriors, favours the boar. Her woad grants extra protection, but makes warriors lose themselves in battlerage.
Old Man Carnuos, the God of the Hunt favours the stag. His woad confers hunters the ability to meld with their surroundings, but makes them extremely vulnerable to fire.
Mhorrinion the Ravenqueen, Daughter of Death, favours the crow. Her woad grants warriors great speed and the ability to cause terror on their foes. at the cost of their physical protection.
Choteich of the Long Arm favours the sun. His woad grants flaming attacks and makes warriors bolder, but it also makes them proud and haughty, more demanding of riches and glory.

The people of Albion cover their bodies in magical woad dye when they go to war. Some of their druids can even enchance this woad further, making it more poerfeul, but also more dangerous to those who use it. it is produced in the Temple of Ishernos and Dye Resource building lines and is used to grant upgrades to some Albion units.
